title: Difference between firefox on laptop versus desktop
content: The results are different when I use Firefox on my desktop versus my laptop. I notice that the results are identical if I use Firefox on my laptop with the results I get using chrome on my desktop or for that matter chrome on my laptop. I prefer to use my desktop and I prefer to use Firefox because I can zoom and also can enter word to search on the page. The results on my desktop tend to repeat as I go to the next page and do not include most of the results I get on chrome. I notice the Firefox on my laptop says "search with google or enter address and it does not say this on my desktop.
creator: SueJohnson

title: Autoimatické spouštění videí nejen na Yotube
content: Dobrý den, zajímalo by mě proč už cca 10 verzí FF zpět vůbec nelze zabránit automatickému spouštění videí? A to nejen na Youtube, ale třeba i na iDnes.cz. A nechoďte na mě s nastavením Oprávnění automatického spoustění, tam nelze vůbec přidat blokované servery. A to samé s ikonou oprávnění v adresním řádku. U Youtube se ta ikona vůbec neukazuje, tudíž automatické spouštění videí nelze nijak zakázat. Děkuji za info, Karel
creator: nudlis1

title: Open link from history in new tab
content:
Hello, (Sorry, bad english level, french ^^).

I post not to ask help, but to give help. I see many asks (here on Mozilla support, Reddit, blogs, etc...) for having history link open in new tab by default. And every body reply i's impossible, nothing in about:config, you must use crtl+left clic or midle-clic (juust see a complex tips with javascript).

And I remember that on my FF, it's worked well, since many years... I never asked myself why, until I reinstall my OS from zero and install a new clear FF.

There is an addon: "New Tab from Location Bar" It is iniatily build for opening in new tab when you write in url bar. And in addon page on mozzila it say it's no more usefull since we can do it with about:config (browser.urlbar.openintab)... that's why I don't reinstall it. Then I lost the history in new tab, can't understand why, and don't find help on web (looking for many hours).

So I try my olds, not reinstalled, addons and find it come from this one. I don't know how it work (don't ask me how), but it's work. Ok on 105.0.3 (actual version of FF) and since many years.

Hope this will help alll those who was looking for a tips.

-)

PS: I tried to reply to olds asks on supports mozilla, but all archived... can't post in so.
creator: poissonrougelechat

title: Youtube, stepped playing, menus instantly dissapearing, shorts not working, so many issues.
content:
I'm becoming really fed up with the way Firefox works with Youtube and am close to migrating to Brave. What's keeping me on here are the convenient add-ons, one which hides the Youtube controls efficiently, addblock, don't care about cookies and a few others. Now I know people are going to say it could be the addons causing the problem but if this was the case these issues would of occurred after installing them. Also it isn't a cache, cookie issue. Please don't advise delete cache and cookies. I've had problems with Youtube shorts instantly jumping to the one below I clicked on, the menus such as notifications and the playback settings on the cog wheel appearing for a split second then immediately disappearing, and now when I press play, the video steps frame by frame instead of playing the video, i.e. I press play, the video advances one frame and then stops.

Firefox, why are you so awkward and full of bugs with Youtube?
creator: Xeys

title: Firefox sync sessions?
content:
I'm confused about sync when it comes to sessions. Sessions is not one of the options.

A few days ago, I open Firefox and my profile was broken. Nothing worked in the way of toolbar addon buttons, contest menus, etc. I narrowed the problem down to the session store files.

The session was still present. I could scroll thru it, and select tabs, but hat was about it. Fortunately I was able to get things back working again in a fresh profile, but it was a tricky exercise.

My desktop sessions sync with my phone. Is the re a way to perhaps sync sessions, and do it recursively so you don't get a mess with duplicates and discarded tabs?

I used to to use Tab Session Manager until a couple years ago when it began destroying sessions, and there was no way to retrieve them. Even the supposedly repaired version couldn't reverse the process. Had something to do with the sessionstore-backups folder, so I don't know if I can trust it now.
creator: noel_envoide

title: X-notifier email client alternative
content:
I've been using X-notifier for a long time. It's toolbar button context menu shows you all your available individual email accounts for access.

In the past, in the case of Gmail, it would take you directly to whichever account selected, but now, regardless of the account you opt for, it takes you to you "default/main" account, and you must the go to the Google accounts menu to chose another account.

Is this a Google idiosyncrasy, or is there another Gmail manager that can do do what I'm looking for?

title: 2FA - 2 Factor Authentication - Cannot set up because old phone was never disabled before being wiped
content:
The issue I am having is that I wiped my old iPhone before disabling two factor authentication. I am not able to login because Firefox wants a code from my old device.

Please advise.

"If you have two-factor authentication (2FA) setup on your account and need to migrate to a new device or phone, here are steps you can take to ensure that you don’t get locked out of your account. Step one: Disable two-step authentication" 

   "Go to https://accounts.firefox.com/settings (you may need to log in).    Enter the authentication code from your authentication application.    After login, under Security next to the Two-step authentication click Disable.    Click Disable on the confirmation".

title: Your system has run out of application memory
content:
I am using the latest version of Firefox with Mojave on a Mac.

Lately I have experienced slowness despite the fact that I didn't add any software and I have Norton checking for viruses. Recently I got a message "Your system has run out of application memory" when I had 5 tabs open in Firefox. I checked Activity Monitor and it showed Firefox using 1.16 GB. 7 other apps were open, the next one with the highest memory usage was Mail (465 MB). Activity Monitor showed 30 instances of FirefoxCP Isolated Web Content entries.

I attached a screen capture showing what Firefox was using in one of these instances. Is this "normal" with 5 tabs open?

I closed the open tabs and quit Firefox. Memory usage by Firefox went down, but after a short time the problem happened again.

A search on the internet showed lots of similar complaints about FirefoxCP Isolated Web Content. Is this a known bug? Any way to avoid this problem?

Thanks.
creator: Zsuzsu

title: Unable to load web page's
content:
What is with Firefox lately. Endless problems with screen sizing, light dark mode. But what is really pi**ing me off is the inability to connect to certain web pages. No I don't have a any spyware or viruses (I have scanned with 3 different programs) and I have no problems with connecting to the pages with Chrome or Edge. I'm getting the error messages

Did Not Connect: Potential Security Issue Firefox detected a potential security threat and did not continue to www.amazon.ca because this website requires a secure connection.

Did Not Connect: Potential Security Issue Firefox detected a potential security threat and did not continue to www.ebay.ca. If you visit this site, attackers could try to steal information like your passwords, emails, or credit card details. Firefox detected a potential security threat and did not continue to www.google.com because this website requires a secure connection.

Did Not Connect: Potential Security Issue Firefox detected a potential security threat and did not continue to www.google.com has a security policy called HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), which means that Firefox can only connect to it securely. You can’t add an exception to visit this site.Error code: SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ISSUER

And I get the same warning with Amazon, eBay, my email client Shaw Mail, Google Search, and several other pages that require a login. Is there anything I can do to fix this as I'm really starting to rethink my preferred web page browser?
